00048 /*===========================================================================
00049  *      File :          l_statistic.c
00050  *      Description :   Execution timing info.
00051  *      Creation Date : June, 1990
00052  *      Author :        Pohua Paul Chang.
00053  *      Modifications:
00054  *      Roger A. Bringmann, February 1993
00055  *      Modified to support new Lcode format.  Reduces memory requirements
00056  *      for a code generator.  Also, adds a more friendly interface for
00057  *      code generation.
00058  *
00059  *  Revision 1.1.1.1  1995/08/30 16:49:04  david
00060  *  Import of IMPACT source
00061  *
00062  * Revision 1.1  1994/01/19  18:49:34  roger
00063  * Initial revision
00064  *
00065  *
00066  *      All rights granted to University of Illinois Board of Regents. 
00067  *==========================================================================*/
00068 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00069 #include <config.h>
00070 #include "l_schedule.h"
00071 
00072 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 static double L_taken_weight(cb, oper)
00074 L_Cb *cb;
00075 L_Oper *oper;
00076 {
00077     L_Flow *flow;
00078 
00079     if (op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_RTS))
00080     {
00081         return (oper->weight);
00082     }
00083     else if (op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_CBR))
00084     {
00085         flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (cb, oper);
00086         return flow->weight;
00087     }
00088     else
00089         return 0.0;
00090 }
00091 static double L_fall_thru_weight(cb, oper)
00092 L_Cb *cb;
00093 L_Oper *oper;
00094 {
00095     if (op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_CBR)) 
00096         return (oper->weight - L_taken_weight(cb, oper));
00097     else 
00098         return (oper->weight);
00099 }
00100 
00101 double L_approx_cb_time(L_Cb *cb)
00102 {
00103     int         k, issue, max_issue, complete, max_complete;
00104     L_Oper      *oper;
00105     double      best_cycle_count=0.0, weight;
00106     int         *max_num_oper;
00107     double      *max_oper_weight;
00108 
00109     if (cb->first_op==0) return 0.0;
00110 
00111     /* FIRST GET SOME STATIC INFORMATION.  */
00112     max_issue = 0;
00113     max_complete = 0;
00114     weight = cb->weight;
00115 
00116     for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00117     {
00118         int opcode;
00119         oper->weight = 0.0;
00120         if (oper->ext==NULL) continue;
00121         oper->weight = weight;
00122         opcode = oper->opc;
00123         if (op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_CBR)) 
00124         {
00125             double taken_weight, fall_thru_weight = 0.0;
00126             L_Flow *flow;
00127             flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (cb, oper);
00128             switch (opcode) 
00129             {
00130                 case Lop_JUMP:
00131                     taken_weight = flow->weight;
00132                     fall_thru_weight = weight - taken_weight;
00133                     break; 
00134                 case Lop_JUMP_FS:
00135                     taken_weight = flow->weight;
00136                     fall_thru_weight = weight - taken_weight;
00137                     break; 
00138                 case Lop_JUMP_RG:
00139                     taken_weight = weight;
00140                     fall_thru_weight = 0.0;
00141                     break;
00142                 case Lop_JUMP_RG_FS:
00143                     taken_weight = weight;
00144                     fall_thru_weight = 0.0;
00145                     break;
00146                 case Lop_BR:
00147                 case Lop_BR_F:
00148                     taken_weight = flow->weight;
00149                     fall_thru_weight = weight - taken_weight;
00150                     break;
00151                 default:
00152                     L_punt("L_approx_cb_time: illegal control oper %d",
00153                         oper->id);
00154                     break;
00155             }
00156             weight = fall_thru_weight;
00157         }  
00158     }
00159 
00160     for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00161     {
00162         if (oper->ext!=NULL)
00163         {
00164             issue = SCHED_INFO(oper)->issue_time;
00165             if (issue > max_issue) max_issue = issue;
00166 
00167             /* change in Sched_Info structure. BLD 6/95 */
00168             complete = Lsched_completion_time(oper);
00169             if (complete > max_complete) max_complete = complete;
00170         }
00171     }
00172 
00173     max_oper_weight = (double *) calloc((max_complete+1), sizeof (double));
00174     if (max_oper_weight==0)
00175         L_punt ("L_approx_cb_time: system out of memory on max_oper_weight!!\n");
00176     max_num_oper = (int *) calloc((max_complete+1), sizeof (int));
00177     if (max_num_oper==0)
00178         L_punt ("L_approx_cb_time: system out of memory on max_num_oper!!\n");
00179 
00180     for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00181     {
00182         if (oper->ext!=NULL)
00183         {
00184             issue = SCHED_INFO(oper)->issue_time;
00185             weight = oper->weight;
00186             max_num_oper[issue] += 1;
00187             if (weight > max_oper_weight[issue])
00188                 max_oper_weight[issue] = weight;
00189         }
00190     }
00191 
00192     for (k=0; k<=max_issue; k++) 
00193     {
00194         /*
00195          *      there may be cycles that issue zero operation.
00196          *  because of the nature of trace
00197          *  scheduling, we simply look for the
00198          *  max. weight in subsequent instructions.
00199          */
00200         int m;
00201         for (m=k+1; m<=max_issue; m++) 
00202         {
00203             if (max_oper_weight[k] < max_oper_weight[m])
00204                 max_oper_weight[k] = max_oper_weight[m];
00205         }
00206         best_cycle_count += max_oper_weight[k];
00207     }
00208 
00209 
00210     free (max_oper_weight);
00211     free (max_num_oper);
00212 
00213     return best_cycle_count;
00214 }
00215 
00216 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00217 /*
00218  * This function assumes that the schedular has been used to generate
00219  * issue times for instructions.  Also, dataflow and compute_oper_weight
00220  * should have been run.
00221  */
00222 void 
00223 L_print_schedule(char *F, L_Func *fn)
00224 {
00225   int   k;
00226   double        total_static_opers=0;
00227   L_Cb          *cb;
00228   L_Oper        *oper;
00229   FILE          *stat_file;
00230   double        br_t_t=0.0, br_t_n=0.0, br_n_t=0.0, br_n_n=0.0,
00231                 jump_t_t=0.0, jump_n_t=0.0, jump_rg_t_t=0.0, jump_rg_n_t=0.0,
00232                 jsr_t_t=0.0, jsr_n_t=0.0, rts_t_t=0.0, rts_n_t=0.0;
00233   /* 10/22/04 REK Commenting out unused variables. */
00234 #if 0
00235   double        ld=0.0,st=0.0;
00236 #endif
00237   double        vliw_oper_count=0.0, superscalar_issue_count=0.0,
00238                 best_cycle_count=0.0, worst_cycle_count=0.0;
00239   double        br_add_penalty = 0.0;
00240   
00241   stat_file = fopen(F, "a");
00242   if (stat_file == 0)
00243     L_punt("L_print_schedule: Error while processing function %s:"
00244            " cannot append to file %s\n", fn->name, F);
00245 
00246   /* Compute branch statistics.  */
00247   for (cb=fn->first_cb; cb!=NULL; cb=cb->next_cb) 
00248     {
00249       double weight;
00250       weight = cb->weight;
00251       for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00252         {
00253           int opcode;
00254           oper->weight = 0.0;
00255 
00256           if (oper->ext==NULL) continue;
00257 
00258           /* Don't count EPILOGUE compiler directives even if not
00259            * marked as IGNORE by the mdes.  (Marking the epilogue 
00260            * as IGNORE can mess up postpass scheduling when other code 
00261            * is pulled into the same block).
00262            * 
00263            * This will make the scheduler statistics match the simulator 
00264            * statistics for all machine descriptions.
00265            * -JCG 2/3/98
00266            */
00267           if (oper->proc_opc == Lop_EPILOGUE) 
00268             continue;
00269 
00270           total_static_opers++;
00271           oper->weight = weight;
00272           opcode = oper->opc;
00273           if (op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_CBR)) 
00274             {
00275               double taken_weight, fall_thru_weight = 0.0;
00276               L_Flow *flow;
00277               flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (cb, oper);
00278               switch (opcode) 
00279                 {
00280                 case Lop_JUMP_RG:
00281                 case Lop_JUMP_RG_FS:
00282                   {
00283                     taken_weight = weight;
00284                     fall_thru_weight = 0.0;
00285                     if(taken_weight > 0)
00286                       {
00287                         jump_rg_n_t += 1;
00288                         jump_rg_t_t += taken_weight - 1;
00289                       }
00290                     break;
00291                   }
00292                 case Lop_JUMP:
00293                 case Lop_JUMP_FS:
00294                   {
00295                     taken_weight = flow->weight;
00296                     fall_thru_weight = weight - taken_weight;
00297                     
00298                     if(!oper->pred[0])
00299                       {
00300                         if(taken_weight > 0)
00301                           {
00302                             jump_n_t += 1;
00303                             jump_t_t += taken_weight - 1;
00304                           }
00305                       }
00306                     else
00307                       {
00308                         if(taken_weight > fall_thru_weight)
00309                           {
00310                             br_t_t += taken_weight;
00311                             br_t_n += fall_thru_weight;
00312                           }
00313                         else
00314                           {
00315                             br_n_t += taken_weight;
00316                             br_n_n += fall_thru_weight;
00317                           }
00318                       }
00319                     break; 
00320                   }
00321                 case Lop_BR:
00322                 case Lop_BR_F:
00323                   {
00324                     taken_weight = flow->weight;
00325                     fall_thru_weight = weight - taken_weight;
00326                     
00327                     if(taken_weight > fall_thru_weight)
00328                       {
00329                         br_t_t += taken_weight;
00330                         br_t_n += fall_thru_weight;
00331                       }
00332                     else
00333                       {
00334                         br_n_t += taken_weight;
00335                         br_n_n += fall_thru_weight;
00336                       }
00337                     break;
00338                   }
00339                 default:
00340                     L_punt("L_print_schedule: illegal control oper");
00341                     break;
00342                 }
00343                 weight = fall_thru_weight;
00344             } 
00345             else
00346               if ((opcode>=Lop_JSR) & (opcode<=Lop_RTS_FS)) 
00347               {
00348                 switch (opcode) 
00349                   {
00350                   case Lop_JSR:
00351                   case Lop_JSR_FS:
00352                     {
00353                       if(weight > 0)
00354                         {
00355                           jsr_n_t += 1;
00356                           jsr_t_t += weight - 1;
00357                         }
00358                       break;
00359                     }
00360                   case Lop_RTS:
00361                   case Lop_RTS_FS:
00362                     {
00363                       if(weight > 0)
00364                         {
00365                           rts_n_t += 1;
00366                           rts_t_t += weight - 1;
00367                         }
00368                       break;
00369                     }
00370                 default:
00371                     L_punt("L_print_schedule: illegal call/return oper");
00372                     break;
00373                 }
00374             }
00375         }
00376     }
00377 
00378     /* Print branch statistics */
00379     fprintf (stat_file, " ( CONTROL %s %s ) \n", fn->name, L_output_file);
00380     fprintf (stat_file, " ( br_t_t %.10f %s ) \n", br_t_t, fn->name);
00381     fprintf (stat_file, " ( br_t_n %.10f %s ) \n", br_t_n, fn->name);
00382     fprintf (stat_file, " ( br_n_t %.10f %s ) \n", br_n_t, fn->name);
00383     fprintf (stat_file, " ( br_n_n %.10f %s ) \n", br_n_n, fn->name);
00384     fprintf (stat_file, " ( jump_t_t %.10f %s ) \n", jump_t_t, fn->name);
00385     fprintf (stat_file, " ( jump_n_t %.10f %s ) \n", jump_n_t, fn->name);
00386     fprintf (stat_file, " ( jump_rg_t_t %.10f %s ) \n", jump_rg_t_t, fn->name);
00387     fprintf (stat_file, " ( jump_rg_n_t %.10f %s ) \n", jump_rg_n_t, fn->name);
00388     fprintf (stat_file, " ( jsr_t_t %.10f %s ) \n", jsr_t_t, fn->name);
00389     fprintf (stat_file, " ( jsr_n_t %.10f %s ) \n", jsr_n_t, fn->name);
00390     fprintf (stat_file, " ( rts_t_t %.10f %s ) \n", rts_t_t, fn->name);
00391     fprintf (stat_file, " ( rts_n_t %.10f %s ) \n", rts_n_t, fn->name);
00392     fprintf (stat_file, " ( static_opers %.10f %s ) \n", total_static_opers, fn->name);
00393 
00394     /*  Compute cycle count.  */
00395     for (cb=fn->first_cb; cb!=NULL; cb=cb->next_cb) 
00396     {
00397         int issue, max_issue, complete, max_complete;
00398         double weight, penalty;
00399         int *max_num_oper;
00400         double *max_oper_weight;
00401 
00402         L_Oper *ptr;
00403         int next_cycle, max_diff, cur_max, dest_max;
00404 
00405         if (cb->first_op==0)
00406             continue;
00407 
00408         /*
00409          *  FIRST GET SOME STATIC INFORMATION.
00410          */
00411         max_issue = 0;
00412         max_complete = 0;
00413         for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00414         {
00415             /* Always ignore EPILOGUE directive, see note above. -JCG 2/3/98 */
00416             if ((oper->ext!=NULL) && (oper->proc_opc != Lop_EPILOGUE))
00417             {
00418                 issue = SCHED_INFO(oper)->issue_time;
00419                 if (issue > max_issue) max_issue = issue;
00420 
00421                 /* change in Sched_Info structure. BLD 6/95 */
00422                 complete = Lsched_completion_time(oper);
00423                 if (complete > max_complete) max_complete = complete;
00424             }
00425         }
00426 
00427         max_oper_weight = (double *) calloc((max_complete+1), sizeof (double));
00428         if (max_oper_weight==0)
00429             L_punt ("L_print_schedule: system out of memory on max_oper_weight!!\n");
00430         max_num_oper = (int *) calloc((max_complete+1), sizeof (int));
00431         if (max_num_oper==0)
00432             L_punt ("L_print_schedule: system out of memory on max_num_oper!!\n");
00433 
00434         for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00435         {
00436             /* Always ignore EPILOGUE directive, see note above. -JCG 2/3/98 */
00437             if ((oper->ext!=NULL) && (oper->proc_opc != Lop_EPILOGUE))
00438             {
00439                 issue = SCHED_INFO(oper)->issue_time;
00440                 weight = oper->weight;
00441                 superscalar_issue_count += weight;
00442                 max_num_oper[issue] += 1;
00443                 if (weight > max_oper_weight[issue])
00444                     max_oper_weight[issue] = weight;
00445             }
00446         }
00447 
00448         for (k=0; k<=max_issue; k++) 
00449         {
00450             /*
00451              *  there may be cycles that issue zero operation.
00452              *  becasue of the nature of trace
00453              *  scheduling, we simply look for the
00454              *  max. weight in subsequent instructions.
00455              */
00456             int m;
00457             for (m=k+1; m<=max_issue; m++) 
00458             {
00459                 if (max_oper_weight[k] < max_oper_weight[m])
00460                     max_oper_weight[k] = max_oper_weight[m];
00461             }
00462             vliw_oper_count += (max_num_oper[k] * max_oper_weight[k]);
00463             best_cycle_count += max_oper_weight[k];
00464             worst_cycle_count += max_oper_weight[k];
00465         }
00466 
00467         /*  CONSERVATIVELY ESTIMATE OPERATION LATENCY FOR  TAKEN BRANCHES.  */
00468         penalty = 0.0;
00469         for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op) 
00470         {
00471             if (op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_CBR) &&
00472                 (oper->ext!=NULL)) 
00473             {
00474                 /*
00475                  *  Here, we are been conservative and ignore
00476                  *  the additional delay due to branch misses.
00477                  */
00478                 max_diff = 0;
00479                 next_cycle = SCHED_INFO(oper)->issue_time + 1;
00480                 for (ptr=oper->prev_op; ptr!=0; ptr=ptr->prev_op) 
00481                 {
00482                     int ii, diff;
00483 
00484                     if (ptr->ext==NULL) continue;
00485 
00486                     /*
00487                      *  We care only if the destination variable
00488                      *  is in the OUT set.
00489                      */
00490                     issue = SCHED_INFO(ptr)->issue_time;
00491                     dest_max = issue;
00492 
00493                     for (ii=0; ii<L_max_dest_operand; ii++)
00494                     {
00495                         if ( (ptr->dest[ii]!=NULL) &&
00496                              (L_in_oper_OUT_set(cb, oper,ptr->dest[ii],TAKEN_PATH)))
00497                         {
00498 #if 0
00499                             if (Lsched_infinite_issue)
00500 
00501                                 cur_max = issue + mdes_operand_latency(ptr->proc_opc, 
00502                                     mdes_heuristic_alt_id(ptr->proc_opc), 
00503                                     operand_index(MDES_DEST, ii));
00504                             else
00505                                 cur_max = issue + mdes_operand_latency(ptr->proc_opc, 
00506                                     RU_SELECTED_ALT_ID(SCHED_INFO(ptr)->ru_info), 
00507                                     operand_index(MDES_DEST, ii));
00508 #endif
00509                                 cur_max = issue + mdes_operand_latency(ptr->proc_opc, 
00510                                     mdes_heuristic_alt_id(ptr->proc_opc), 
00511                                     operand_index(MDES_DEST, ii));
00512 
00513                             if (cur_max > dest_max)
00514                                 dest_max = cur_max;
00515                         }
00516                     }
00517                     diff = dest_max - next_cycle;
00518 
00519                     if (diff > max_diff)
00520                         max_diff = diff;
00521                 }
00522                 penalty += L_taken_weight(cb, oper) * max_diff;
00523             }
00524             /*
00525              *  We can ignore jsr/rts, because arguments are
00526              *  assigned into macro registers, and the delay
00527              *  has been accounted for.
00528              */
00529         }
00530 
00531         /* CONSERVATIVELY ESTIMATE OPERATION LATENCY FOR THE FALL-THRU PATH. */
00532         oper = cb->last_op;
00533         /* Always ignore EPILOGUE directive, see note above. -JCG 2/3/98 */
00534         if (!op_flag_set(oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_RTS) &&
00535             (oper->ext!=NULL) && (oper->proc_opc != Lop_EPILOGUE)) 
00536         {
00537             max_diff = 0;
00538             next_cycle = SCHED_INFO(oper)->issue_time + 1;
00539             for (ptr=oper->prev_op; ptr!=NULL; ptr=ptr->prev_op) 
00540             {
00541                 int diff, ii;
00542                 if (ptr->ext==NULL) continue;
00543 
00544                 /*
00545                  *      We care only if the destination variable
00546                  *      is in the OUT set.
00547                  */
00548                 issue = SCHED_INFO(ptr)->issue_time;
00549                 dest_max = issue;
00550 
00551                 for (ii=0; ii<L_max_dest_operand; ii++)
00552                 {
00553                     if ( (ptr->dest[ii]!=NULL) &&
00554                          (L_in_cb_OUT_set(cb, ptr->dest[ii])) )
00555                     {
00556 #if 0
00557                         if (Lsched_infinite_issue)
00558                             cur_max = issue + mdes_operand_latency(ptr->proc_opc, 
00559                                 mdes_heuristic_alt_id(ptr->proc_opc), 
00560                                 operand_index(MDES_DEST, ii));
00561                         else
00562                             cur_max = issue + mdes_operand_latency(ptr->proc_opc, 
00563                                 RU_SELECTED_ALT_ID(SCHED_INFO(ptr)->ru_info), 
00564                                 operand_index(MDES_DEST, ii));
00565 #endif
00566                             cur_max = issue + mdes_operand_latency(ptr->proc_opc, 
00567                                 mdes_heuristic_alt_id(ptr->proc_opc), 
00568                                 operand_index(MDES_DEST, ii));
00569 
00570                         if (cur_max > dest_max)
00571                             dest_max = cur_max;
00572                     }
00573                 }
00574                 diff = dest_max - next_cycle;
00575 
00576                 if (diff > max_diff)
00577                     max_diff = diff;
00578             }
00579             penalty += L_fall_thru_weight(cb, oper) * max_diff;
00580         }
00581         worst_cycle_count += penalty;
00582 
00583         free (max_oper_weight);
00584         free (max_num_oper);
00585     }
00586     worst_cycle_count += br_add_penalty;        /* WYC 10-2-91 */
00587 
00588     /* Print cycle times */
00589     fprintf (stat_file, " ( TIME %s %s ) \n", fn->name, L_output_file);
00590     fprintf (stat_file, " ( vliw_oper_count %.10f %s ) \n", 
00591         vliw_oper_count, fn->name);
00592     fprintf (stat_file, " ( superscalar_issue_count %.10f %s ) \n",
00593         superscalar_issue_count, fn->name);
00594     fprintf (stat_file, " ( best_cycle_count %.10f %s ) \n", 
00595         best_cycle_count, fn->name);
00596     fprintf (stat_file, " ( worst_cycle_count %.10f %s ) \n", 
00597         worst_cycle_count, fn->name);
00598 
00599     fclose (stat_file);
00600 }
